nameLower: cloud services vendor evaluation report q1 2024
name: Cloud Services Vendor Evaluation Report Q1 2024
content:
Cloud Services Vendor Evaluation Report

Q1 2024

Executive Summary:

Comprehensive evaluation of major cloud service providers for SynergyOS's infrastructure expansion project. Analysis focused on performance, cost-effectiveness, security features, and integration capabilities.

Vendors Evaluated:

  1. Amazon Web Services (AWS)

  2. Microsoft Azure

  3. Google Cloud Platform (GCP)

Evaluation Criteria:

  • Technical Capabilities

    • Compute resources

    • Storage solutions

    • Network infrastructure

    • AI/ML services

  • Security & Compliance

    • Data protection

    • Access controls

    • Compliance certifications

  • Cost Structure

    • Pay-as-you-go pricing

    • Reserved instances

    • Volume discounts

  • Support & Service

    • SLA terms

    • Technical support

    • Documentation

Scoring Summary (out of 100):

  • AWS: 92

    • Technical: 95

    • Security: 94

    • Cost: 88

    • Support: 91

  • Azure: 89

    • Technical: 90

    • Security: 92

    • Cost: 85

    • Support: 89

  • GCP: 87

    • Technical: 88

    • Security: 90

    • Cost: 86

    • Support: 84

Cost Comparison (Monthly Estimate):

  • AWS: $45,000

  • Azure: $48,000

  • GCP: $46,500

Key Findings:

  1. AWS leads in technical capabilities and market presence

  2. Azure offers strong enterprise integration

  3. GCP excels in data analytics and ML services

Recommendation:

Based on our evaluation, we recommend proceeding with AWS as our primary cloud provider, with Azure as a secondary provider for specific enterprise workloads. This multi-cloud approach will provide optimal flexibility and risk mitigation.

Next Steps:

  1. Contract negotiation with AWS

  2. Migration planning

  3. Team training program
